features: Razorless Shaving Powder: Formulated especially for Black Men to help stop razor bumps, this Shaving Powder (depilatory) provides a clean, razorless shave. This formula features a light, fresh fragrance.
For All Beard Types: Our Magic Razorless Shaving Powder comes in 4 formulations: Skin Conditioning, With Fragrance, Regular Strength and Extra Strength. Also available in the cream shave formulation.

Hair Removal For Men: We make an array of products for all beard types and shaved heads, including razorless depilatory creams and powders to prevent razor bumps, plus exfoliating cleansers and moisturizers
For Mens' Grooming Needs: From shaving to hair color, mens hair removal cream, pomade and hair moisturizer, find the products specifically formulated for black men that suit your grooming routine.
Softsheen-Carson: For over 110 years we have provided beauty to all consumers of African descent with our innovative, tailor-made, superior products and services specially designed for their needs.
body.description: A shaving powder (depilatory) formulated for black men to help stop razor bumps. Provides a clean, razorless shave that lasts up to 4 days. Fresh fragrance. • Razorless shave helps stop razor bumps • Lasts up to 4 days • Fresh fragrance • We believe in beauty without compromise Always read all product labeling and instructions completely prior to use. IMPORTANT: Contains Thioglycolate. If skin is inflamed or has abrasions, sores or pustules, consult dermatologist before use. Conduct sensitivity test before use. Wait 36 hours after using razor, shaving product or depilatory. Do not use with any after shave containing alcohol. Only for removal of facial hair. This is a safety summary. Read all product labeling and instructions completely.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Magic Shave since 1901 The best way to get rid of razor bumps is to get rid of the razor. With Magic Shave, the grooming expert for African American Men (since 1901). No shaving with a razor. Magic Shave is not a shave cream but a razor-less shaving system.

Magic Shave Creams The New and Improved Magic Shave with Light Fresh Scent available in Extra Strength, Regular Strength and Bald Head. Works in 4 minutes and Lasts for 4 Days. No shaving with a razor. No water necessary just apply.

Magic Shave Powders The original Magic Shave powder available in Extra Strength, Regular Strength, Fragrant and Skin Conditioning formulated for black men . No shaving with a razor. Just mix with water and apply.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This is NOT A JOKE!
reviews.reviewText: To begin, I must admit that when I first stumbled upon Magic Razorless Shaving Powder, I was skeptical and almost considered it a gag gift. However, given its incredibly affordable price, I decided to give it a shot just to satisfy my curiosity. And let me tell you – WOW, IT'S NOT A JOKE!The application process is simple and straightforward. The powder effortlessly mixes with water to form a smooth paste. Applying it to the desired areas for hair removal is a breeze. I followed the instructions religiously, letting the mixture sit for the recommended time before wiping it off with a damp washcloth. The results were nothing short of magical.What impressed me the most was the lack of any burning sensation during or after the application. I even dared to use it on more sensitive skin after initially testing it on my leg, and to my surprise, it outperformed a razor. The precision and smoothness it achieved were unparalleled.Magic Razorless Shaving Powder has truly revolutionized my grooming routine. It's not only cost-effective but also delivers results that surpass traditional shaving methods. Say goodbye to razors and hello to the magic that is this incredible shaving powder! I wholeheartedly give it a glowing 5-star rating for its effectiveness, ease of use, and unbeatable value.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I was spending $100 a month at the waxing studio. This has saved us $100s of dollars. Easy to use and very effective. 5 minutes a month and hairless all over!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2023
reviews.reviewText: So I have pcos and have struggled with excess body hair since puberty and have tried just about everything to deal with it. Shaving, waxing, nair, veet, etc. and I have to say this is one of the better products I’ve tried!I did a test patch on my arm first and it worked well and didn’t bother my skin at all so I tried it last night pretty much from my toes up to my hips as well as on my bikini line and tummy. I left it on for 6 and a half minutes and man did it work! I did just like the directions said and mixed it up (in total it took about 6 tablespoons of powder plus 6 of water to cover everything) and then I used a spray bottle to keep all the spots wet when they started to dry. I used a damp rag to wipe it all away and the hair just came right off!The smell wasn’t too strong and wasn’t unpleasant, but the powder is so fine it did want to get everywhere while I was mixing it and it was a bit messy to apply. The one thing I did notice is that although it didn’t leave any tender, itchy, or painful spots on the places I applied it, it did greatly bother my hands where I have eczema at so I would definitely wear gloves next time I use it. It felt like it took off the top layer of skin on my hands, so if you have eczema or sensitive skin I would be careful with it. It left the skin on my legs super soft tho!The only reason I gave this 4 stars instead of 5 is that I already feel like I’m starting to get a little stubble back the next day. It’s not as bad as it usually is the day after shaving, but I was sort of under the assumption that it would be more like veet or nair where it took a couple days for the hair to grow back. Still a great product but disappointing that I’ll have to use it almost as often as I would regularly have to shave.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Hair texture is important
reviews.reviewText: As a coiled haired womanCurly Afro like hair.I wanted something that didn’t have too many chemicals as nair. The smell is kinda bad. And it’s a pain to wash or wipe off other surfaces around the application area and objects.Doesn’t get to the root of the follicleKinda just topical hair removalMaybe my hair is just too thick idkAlso getting a good mixture n amount is hard because it drys so thin and at least for me it doesn’t get all of it in a wet swipe away. And hard to water off in the shower.I listened to TikTok…

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars My. Face. Is. On. Fire.
reviews.reviewText: I think I found a review of this product in one of my daily news feed, where it was praised as something borderline miraculous that could help with ingrown hairs. For $1.75 (that should’ve been my first red flag), close to 14k reviews (at the time of this writing), and 4 stars, this was bound to truly be the shaving dream that was missing from my life.Following the instructions as a test was okay. No real irritation, but no beard came off. I brushed it off as a non-issue, and decided I would try at some other time.Enter today.Again, judiciously following the instructions, I applied the watery paste on my entire face and neck. Second red flag, the smell of hair-dissolving chemical should’ve alerted me (a la Danger, Will Robinson!), but NO, of course it was just the smell of the fragrance—or so I told myself—and set to let it sit for the suggested 7 minutes. So far so good, my skin tingled a bit, but nothing terrible just yet!The instructions said to use a damp cloth to remove the paste along with your now-dissolved beard, so I did that. As I began wiping my face, the _burn_ started to set in. You can see it in the picture: not just some of my beard came off, but parts of the upper layer of my skin, too. After I cleaned the mixture off my face with the cloth, the horrible chemical burn set in. The instructions stated to use water to clean off any excess, so I practically submerged my face in water to help with the burn, and removed what was left of the paste from my face and neck.It has been easily 15 minutes since I finished and that I decided to write this review, and my face is still burning. Needless to say, I tossed the product in the garbage, and begged my kids to not trust everything they read on the Internet. Did I mention this stuff didn’t even remove all of my beard? Funny, the instructions do state to repeat the process after 24 hours if you have any beard remaining, but there is no way on this green Earth that I am putting a spec of that stuff on my face ever again.Save yourself the pain, the discomfort, and don’t use this unless you don’t care for your face feeling and looking like it was dragged on cement.
